Title: A more severe strain of mpox has been detected in the U.S. for the first time
Description: The patient was traveling from East Africa, where the mpox disease is endemic. The CDC says the strain does not present a high risk to the general population. (Image credit: Smith Collection)

Title: You're doing such a good job': A stranger tells a mom just what she needs to hear
Description: Emma Carlson Berne was at a restaurant, feeling overwhelmed with her three young children. Then a stranger came over with words she's never forgotten: 'What a beautiful family.' (Image credit: Emma Carlson Berne)

Title: Leaders of the world's largest economies are gathering in Rio de Janeiro
Description: As Brazil hosts the G-20 summit, it is likely President Biden's last international gathering. The meeting's agenda may be overshadowed by the incoming Trump administration.

Title: Trump's threats of mass deportations lead to hard discussions for families
Description: More than 11 million U.S. citizens live with an undocumented immigrant. Since Donald Trump's election win, many of these folks are having a difficult conversation: what to do if someone gets deported.

Title: In 'The Atlantic,' Dartmouth president writes: 'Saving the Idea of the University'
Description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Dartmouth College President Sian Beilock about how the school dealt with Gaza protests and other issues.

Title: Venezuela still holds hundreds of political prisoners -- dozens are minors
Description: Months after the disputed election results in Venezuela, there are a number of children still in prison. They are accused of taking part in anti-regime protests.

Title: As Hurricane Helene toppled trees, it also destroyed farmers' nest eggs
Description: The winds of hurricane Helene knocked down thousands of acres of trees across four states. Now tree farmers are looking for help as they don't have crop insurance.

Title: Morning news brief
Description: President Biden permits Ukraine to fire long-range U.S. missiles into Russia. Leaders of the world's largest economies are gathering in Brazil. President-elect Trump promises to end fentanyl crisis.

Title: 2 killed, 10 wounded in shootings near New Orleans parade route
Description: Two people were killed and 10 others were wounded in two separate shootings along a New Orleans parade route and celebration attended by thousands on Sunday, authorities said. There were no immediate arrests. (Image credit: David Grunfeld)

Title: No planes and no 'spoilers.' How one man trekked from Egypt to Japan without flying
Description: Omar Nok is at the finish line of a 28,000-mile zig-zag route that began in February. Here's how he approached the adventure, without setting foot on a plane.

Title: Bela Karolyi, legendary and controversial gymnastics coach, dies at 82
Description: Bela Karolyi coached several renowned gymnasts, including Mary Lou Retton, Kerri Strug and Julianne McNamara. But he was known for harsh methods of training. (Image credit: Elise Amendola)

Title: Senior Hezbollah official is killed in Israeli airstrike
Description: In Lebanon, a senior Hezbollah official has been killed in an Israeli airstrike. The official was head of the militant group's media operations.

Title: Biden marks his climate legacy during Amazon visit, asserting 'nobody' can reverse it
Description: Some may seek to deny or delay the clean energy revolution that's underway in America, but nobody — nobody — can reverse it,' Biden said. But Trump has vowed to roll back those plans. (Image credit: Saul Loeb)

Title: From Trump opponent to Trump loyalist: The evolution of Marco Rubio
Description: When compared to some of president-elect Trump's other cabinet picks, Senator Marco Rubio for Secretary of State is a pretty conventional choice.He's a veteran politician who served on the foreign relations and intelligence committees for over a decade, and he's been a loyal Trump backer throughout this year's campaign. But when you look back at Marco Rubio during his 2016 presidential campaign, there's a striking contrast. When he ran against Trump in 2016, Rubio called him a con artist, and described his style of leadership as dangerous. Now, he's going to work for him. Marco Rubio's political evolution is indicative of how the Republican Party has remade itself around Donald Trump, and it gives some clues about how he may operate as the nation's top diplo...

Title: In a first, Biden allows Ukraine to strike Russia with U.S. long-range weapons
Description: The U.S. is allowing Ukraine to use the powerful long-range weapons to strike in and around Kursk — the same region where some 10,000 North Korean troops were recently deployed. (Image credit: John Hamilton)

Title: A rare Israeli strike on central Beirut kills Hezbollah's spokesman, official says
Description: A rare Israeli airstrike on central Beirut killed Hezbollah's chief spokesman on Sunday, an official with the militant group said. Earlier, Israeli strikes killed at least 12 in the Gaza Strip. (Image credit: Hassan Ammar/AP)

Title: Typhoon Man-yi lashes the Philippines, displacing hundreds of thousands
Description: A powerful typhoon forced hundreds of thousands of people to flee to emergency shelters as it cut across the northern Philippines on Sunday. (Image credit: AP)

Title: Trump taps oil executive Chris Wright as Secretary of Energy
Description: President-elect Trump has picked oil executive Chris Wright for his nominee for Secretary of Energy. The Trump administration is expected to shift the department's focus away from clean energy initiatives championed under Biden.

Title: Matt Gaetz's road to Attorney General may not be completely in the clear
Description: Matt Gaetz resigned from Congress ahead of the release of an ethics report about him but still faces hurdles for confirmation for Attorney General.

Title: Idaho's abortion ban, one of the strictest in the U.S., is being challenged in court
Description: Arguments began last week in a lawsuit challenging Idaho's abortion ban, one of the strictest in the country. We'll hear from some of the plaintiffs and the state attorney.

Title: Trump has vowed to take an aggressive approach to China. What would that mean?
Description: What will President-elect Donald Trump's return to the White House mean for US - China relations? NPR's Ayesha Rascoe talks to Ryan Hass, a China expert at the Brookings Institution.

Title: A new law in New York will do away with broker fees
Description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks with New York City Council Member Chi Ossé about his FARE act, which shifts the responsibility for broker fees from the tenant to the landlord in many cases.

Title: A new law in New York does away with broker fees
Description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks with New York City Council Member Chi Ossé about his FARE act, which shifts the responsibility for broker fees from the tenant to the landlord in many cases.

Title: Key IRS funds dry out in 2026. What can we expect for its future?
Description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe asks the Urban-Brookings Tax Policy Center's Janet Holtzblatt about funding for the Internal Revenue Service.

Title: In Gaza, a nurse takes in an orphaned baby too young to know who she is
Description: A nurse is fostering a baby from Gaza whose family was killed and whose identity has been lost.

Title: Survivors of the Super Bowl parade shooting in Kansas City grapple with the aftermath
Description: After one person died and more than 20 more were injured at shootings around a Kansas City Chiefs Super Bowl victory celebration Feb. 14, survivors continue to cope with the aftermath.

Title: Meet North Carolina's sexiest collard farmer
Description: What does it take to be the sexiest collard farmer in North Carolina? Lee Berry, the reigning champ and current competitor in the contest's 2nd year, explains.

Title: Some in the U.S. farm industry are alarmed by Trump's embrace of RFK Jr. and tariffs
Description: President-elect Trump won landslide support in much of farm country, but his embrace of Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and his plan for a tariff fight with China alarms many farmers and agriculture experts. (Image credit: Rebecca Noble)

Title: Local news is in crisis. This paper has a $150 million plan
Description: Nearly two years ago, the owners of Atlanta's leading newspaper hired former CNN executive Andrew Morse to reverse its steep decline. He's laid out a grand vision. (Image credit: Paras Griffin)

Title: The USPS will honor Betty White with her own stamp in 2025
Description: Having received hundreds to thousands of fan mail each week, it's only fitting to honor White with a postage stamp. (Image credit: U.S. Postal Service)

Title: Russia launches massive attack on Ukraine's energy infrastructure, Zelenskyy says
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Sunday that Russia launched 120 missiles and 90 drones in a large-scale attack across Ukraine, targeting its energy infrastructure. (Image credit: Denes Erdos)

Title: Scientists find a 35,000-year-old saber-toothed kitten in the Siberian permafrost
Description: The kitten, which was found in Russia's northeastern Sakha Republic, still had fur and whiskers when it was discovered. (Image credit: Lopatin et al. Scientific Reports)

Title: Biden and Xi take a first step to limit AI and nuclear decisions at their last meeting
Description: The leaders agreed that humans should control decisions to use nuclear weapons — not AI. And they talked about the importance of stability during the transition to a new U.S. administration. (Image credit: Leah Millis)

Title: Trump's threatened tariffs could push Latin American economies closer to China
Description: President Biden and China's President Xi held their last face-to-face meeting at a trade summit in Peru. But President-elect Trump's threatened tariffs could push the region into Beijing's arms.

Title: Trump's policies blindsided Canada last time round. What's in store for round 2?
Description: Canada is bracing itself for a second Trump presidency, with an incoming administration that doesn't pull its punches when expressing opinions about Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's politics.

Title: Trump's policies blindsided Canada 4 years ago. What's in store for round 2?
Description: Canada is bracing itself for a second Trump presidency, with an incoming administration that doesn't pull its punches when expressing opinions about Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's politics.

Title: Trump announces oil executive Chris Wright as his pick for energy secretary
Description: Trump announced Chris Wright, the CEO of oil and natural gas fracking services company Liberty Energy, as his pick for energy secretary. (Image credit: Alastair Pike)

Title: A derogatory term for Native women will be removed from place names across California
Description: The word 'squaw' was declared derogatory by the Department of Interior in 2021. Since then, hundreds of geographic features have been renamed with input from local tribes and Indigenous communities. (Image credit: Max Whittaker)

Title: Sixth beach house collapses in North Carolina's Outer Banks in the past 6 months
Description: The daily effects of strong winds, large waves, as well as rising sea levels — which are fueled by human-caused climate change — are causing beaches on the Outer Banks to wash away.

Title: In France, a family reckons with World War II Allies' legacy of rape and murder
Description: In 1944, as Allied troops celebrated D-Day victory, a French family experienced a trauma that would be felt for generations: a murder and sexual assault so traumatic they are only now coming to terms with it. (Image credit: Eleanor Beardsley)

Title: Fire engulfs a hospital ward in northern India, killing 10 newborn babies
Description: A fire tore through a neonatal intensive care unit in a hospital in northern India, killing 10 newborn babies and injuring 16 others, authorities said. (Image credit: AP)

Title: Nursing aides plagued by PTSD after 'nightmare' COVID conditions, with little help
Description: Some of the lowest-paid essential workers during the pandemic also suffered the most trauma. Nursing aides have had trouble getting healthcare officials to pay attention to their plight.

Title: Israel's escalating attack on Lebanon is destroying entire communities
Description: We look at the efforts to broker a ceasefire between the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah and Israel. Fighting has escalated between the two, pushing the conflict deeper into Lebanon.

Title: Trump's national security team lacks experience but has proven loyalty to him
Description: President-elect Trump assembled his national security team with a series of rapid-fire choices. There's a clear pattern: Most nominees are best known for their support of Trump rather than their national security experience.

Title: What life is like as a woman in Afghanistan, three years into Taliban rule
Description: NPR's Scott Simon speaks to Sahar Fetrat a researcher at Human Rights Watch, about the lives of women in Afghanistan now, as the Taliban continue to limit their presence in public life.

Title: This county is the most religiously diverse in the U.S.
Description: This stretch of New Hampshire Avenue in Silver Spring, Maryland is so packed with houses of worship, it's been called the Embassy Row of Religions. But locals know it as the Highway to Heaven. (Image credit: Sarah Ventre)

Title: The NWSL rides a 'rocket ship' of interest in women's sports to a record-setting year
Description: Across the board, 2024 was a record year for women's sports. The WNBA saw record audiences. In college basketball, the women's March Madness tournament outdrew the men's. The NWSL was no exception. (Image credit: Timothy Nwachukwu)

Title: Women stock up on abortion pills and Plan B, fearing new restrictions under Trump
Description: Telehealth providers say requests for the pills have spiked since the election. Patients and doctors worry what a Trump presidency could mean for medical abortion and emergency contraception. (Image credit: Charlie Neibergall)

Title: Bullet strikes Southwest Airlines plane at Dallas Love Field Airport
Description: There were no reported injuries on the plane, which was struck while preparing for takeoff, Southwest Airlines said. The plane safely taxied back to the terminal after the incident. (Image credit: Rick Gershon)

Title: Germany's Scholz discusses Ukraine with Russia's Putin in first such call in 2 years
Description: The new communication between Scholz and Putin — their first since December 2022 — comes at a time of speculation about what the new administration of President-elect Trump will mean for Ukraine. (Image credit: Michael Kappeler/AP)

Title: Judge blocks Biden administration's rule to expand overtime pay for millions
Description: A federal judge in Texas has blocked a new rule from the Biden administration that would have expanded access to overtime pay to millions more salaried workers across the U.S. (Image credit: J. Scott Applewhite)

Title: Trump picks Karoline Leavitt to be youngest White House press secretary in history
Description: Leavitt will be the youngest person to ever hold the job and is expected to deliver press briefings based on Trump's statement late Friday that he has 'utmost confidence she will excel at the podium.' (Image credit: Seth Wenig)

Title: Israel's airstrikes on remote areas in Lebanon have killed almost 200
Description: Israel has recently attacked locations far from the fighting, killing in total almost 200 displaced Lebanese people. NPR went to the site of one of those attacks.

Title: Scientific American editor resigns after comments about Trump supporters went viral
Description: Laura Helmuth announced her resignation from the long-running magazine after her statements on election night regarding Trump sparked outrage among conservatives. (Image credit: Matt McClain/The Washington Post)

Title: The great German land lottery
Description: Every ten years, a group of German farmers gather in the communal farm fields of the Osing for the Osingverlosung, a ritual dating back centuries. Osing refers to the area. And verlosung means 'lottery,' as in a land lottery. All of the land in this communal land is randomly reassigned to farmers who commit to farming it for the next decade.Hundreds of years ago, a community in Germany came up with their own, unique solution for how to best allocate scarce resources. For this community, the lottery is a way to try and make the system of land allotment more fair and avoid conflict.Today on the show, we go to the lottery and follow along as every farmer has a shot at getting the perfect piece of land — or the absolute worst piece of land! And we see...

Title: Malcolm X's daughters sue the CIA, FBI and NYPD over the civil rights leader's assassination
Description: A $100 million lawsuit claims the agencies were aware of and were involved in the1965 assassination plot and failed to stop the killing of the civil rights leader. (Image credit: Ron Frehm)

Title: Maori lawmakers perform haka to disrupt controversial bill vote in New Zealand
Description: Parliament was briefly suspended on Thursday after Maori members performed a haka — a traditional ceremonial group dance — to disrupt the vote on a controversial bill.

Title: The Price Israel and Lebanon are Each Paying for Their War on the Border
Description: We bring you views from both sides of the conflict between Israel and Lebanon. Israel says they're closer to accomplishing their mission of pushing Hezbollah militants away from the border so that tens of thousands of Israelis can safely return to the area. Our correspondent visits the tense borderland and finds a dramatically changed landscape. And in Lebanon, intense Israeli airstrikes since September have taken their toll. And recently, strikes have occurred deeper in the country, far away from the fighting, endangering and killing displaced Lebanese civilians. We go to the site of a recent attack. For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates (Image credit: Violeta ...

Title: Murder trial begins for man accused of killing Georgia student Laken Riley
Description: The 22-year-old nursing student's death fueled an emotional and politically charged debate over immigration and crime after authorities said the suspect was a man who entered the U.S. illegally. (Image credit: Mike Stewart)

Title: Why the White House hasn't benefited much from investing in infrastructure
Description: The Biden administration is touting the third anniversary of the bipartisan infrastructure law that pumped billions into roads, bridges, airports and more. But there's been little political benefit. (Image credit: Drew Angerer)

Title: Trump claims he can bring peace to the world. In India, many believe him
Description: The world's most populous country has consistently favorable views of U.S. President-elect Trump. In a Pew Research Center poll, 42% of Indians, including 51% of men, said they had confidence in him. (Image credit: Narinder Nanu)

Title: Animal rescuers evacuate a lion cub from war-torn Lebanon to South Africa
Description: The group Animals Lebanon says it rescued Sara the lion cub from abuse by a Lebanese social media influencer, kept it safe in Beirut and sent it to a wildlife sanctuary in South Africa. (Image credit: Ali Khara for NPR)

Title: Gophers needed 1 day after Mount St. Helens erupted to bring explosions of new life
Description: Scientists say the pocket gophers were cranky about being moved into a devastated landscape for a day in 1980. But decades later, their short visit still has visible, and vibrant, effects. (Image credit: Bob Parmenter)

Title: What's going on with the 'magic' drug for malaria?
Description: The anti-malarial drug Artemisinin is highly effective. It's critical for kids, who are especially vulnerable. A new study comes to an alarming conclusion. (Image credit: Huang Xiaobang/Xinhua via Getty Images)

Title: He's 14. He loves soccer. He's the sole caregiver for his little twin brothers
Description: Mahamat Djouma is one of the millions displaced by the civil war in Sudan. He is part of an especially vulnerable group — unaccompanied minors. Here is his story. (Image credit: Claire Harbage/NPR)

Title: Police welcome Trump's return to the White House
Description: Police officers backed Trump's reelection, but police reform advocates wonder what that will mean for police accountability (Image credit: Evan Vucci)

Title: The treaty between Russia and North Korea signals a new era on 2 continents
Description: The recently signed mutual defense treaty could be used to justify thewidening of the war in Ukraine, as the U.S. says North Korean and Russian troops are already battling Ukrainian forces. (Image credit: VLADIMIR SMIRNOV)

Title: At Tiananmen Square, tight security with metal detectors reflects a changing China
Description: There's a police check to exit the subway, another to get in line, a third while standing in line, and metal detectors and X-ray machines before you finally reach the Beijing landmark. (Image credit: Andrea Verdelli)

Title: One thing Trump and Obama have in common: a fondness for 'czars'
Description: Trump is the latest president to appoint a czar to deal with a particular issue — in this case, the border. But what does that mean? A look at the controversial history of government czars. (Image credit: Drew Angerer)

Title: What's behind defense secretary pick Hegseth's war on 'woke'
Description: The selection of Fox News host Pete Hegseth to lead the Trump Defense Department has renewed scrutiny of his political and religious views and his aggressive criticism of the military he would be leading. (Image credit: Spencer Platt)

Title: Outspent 4-to-1, Republicans still made gains in state legislative elections
Description: Despite outspending Republicans, Democrats didn't achieve some ambitious goals in state legislative races. The GOP continues to control more legislatures, though Democrats notched some victories. (Image credit: Al Goldis)

Title: Morning news brief
Description: President-elect Trump picks RFK Jr. to head the Department of Health and Human Services, the bond market reacts to Trump's reelection, and President Biden meets Chinese President Xi Jinping in Peru.

Title: Police union welcomes Trump's return to the White House
Description: Police Welcome Trump: The Fraternal Order of Police has backed Trump for years, and now the union is celebrating what they see as a return to law and order and respect for law enforcement. What are their hopes -- and police reformers' fears -- for Trump's second term?

Title: Regional power authority approves request for Musk's Memphis AI supercomputer project
Description: The regional power authority in Memphis approved a request for enough energy to power a small city. Elon Musk's AI company will use it for a massive supercomputer. The project was a surprise to many.

Title: A nurse recalls the 1998 bombing of an Alabama health clinic that performed abortions
Description: Not much intimidates you once you've been blown up.' A nurse remembers surviving the bombing of a health clinic that performed abortions in Alabama in the 1990s.

Title: A new Maine State Prison program offers Muslim inmates a path to rehabilitation
Description: Across the country, Muslim prison chaplains are in short supply. A new program offers classes to Muslim inmates designed to use faith as a pathway to rehabilitation and reentry.

Title: President Biden to meet Chinese President Xi Jinping
Description: President Biden is in Lima, Peru, where he's meeting with leaders from the Asia-Pacific region, including Chinese President Xi Jinping. It's expected to be their final meeting.

Title: Large parts of South Asia blanketed in thick smog visible from space
Description: A blanket of thick smog has settled over swaths of South Asia. One of the hardest-hit areas is the Indian capital Delhi and the surrounding region, which is home to an estimated 34 million people.

Title: South Africa's government won't help the illegal miners inside a closed mine
Description: Miners are believed to be suffering from a lack of food, water and other basic necessities after police closed off the entrances used to transport supplies. (Image credit: Jerome Delay)

Title: Masses of residents flee homes in Haiti's capital as gangs ratchet up violence
Description: Violence has exploded in Port-au-Prince since Sunday when the Haiti's interim prime minister was fired amid political infighting. (Image credit: Odelyn Joseph)

Title: Trump picks North Dakota Gov. Doug Burgum to lead the Interior Department
Description: Burgum ran in the 2024 Republican presidential primary. He then became a vocal supporter of Preesident-elect Donald Trump and was shortlisted for the GOP vice presidential nomination. (Image credit: Kamil Krzaczynski)

Title: Texas company, supervisor indicted in fatal 2021 trench collapse
Description: A Bastrop, Texas, man was working in a trench when it collapsed. He died a week later.

Title: Oklahoma City cop is investigated for slamming 70-year-old man to the ground
Description: Lich Vu has been in the hospital since the Oct. 27 incident that left him with a brain bleed and a broken neck. The altercation with the police officer involved a dispute over a traffic ticket. (Image credit: Oklahoma City Police Department)

Title: Peter Hegseth's tattoos are raising some eyebrows
Description: President-Elect Donald Trump's pick for Secretary of Defense — Peter Hegseth — has gotten a lot of attention for his tattoos.

Title: The status of Israel's operation in southern Lebanon
Description: Israeli officials say they're closer to declaring 'mission accomplished' in southern Lebanon. They aimed to push Hezbollah militia away from the border so thousands of Israelis can return to the area.

Title: Palestinians are nervous as Mike Huckabee is named ambassador to Israel
Description: Trump has named the ambassador to Israel as former Arkansas Gov. Mike Huckabee, who says there is no such place as the West Bank.

Title: Argentina's Leader Celebrates Trump's Election; a Possible New Country in Europe
Description: In Argentina, President Javier Milei is celebrating both the success of this radical cost cutting in lowering inflation and the re-election of Donald Trump in the U.S. The ultra-libertarian has said that he wants to 'make Argentina great again' and is travelling to Florida to congratulate Trump in person. We hear how Argentinians are reacting. And without a war, a revolution or even a debate, plans for a brand new country were announced by Albania's prime minister. We learn why.

Title: They told insurers a bear damaged their car. But it was actually a person in a costume
Description: Four LA residents allegedly defrauded multiple insurance companies of over $141,000. A wildlife expert who reviewed footage of the incidents said that the culprit was 'clearly a human in a bear suit.'

Title: Florida sues FEMA for discrimination accusing it of denying aid to Trump supporters
Description: Fla. Attorney General Ashley Moody is suing Federal Emergency Management Agency Administrator Deanne Criswell, and a former FEMA supervisor for violating Floridians' civil rights after hurricanes. (Image credit: Joe Raedle)

Title: Lindsey Vonn announces a comeback at 40, saying she's ready to race
Description: The record-setting skier once notched speeds that would be illegal on most U.S. highways — until knee injuries slowed her down and she retired in 2019. Now Vonn says she's ready to return to racing. (Image credit: Elsa)

Title: Stargazers can see the final supermoon of the year this weekend
Description: The next supermoon — which appears larger and brighter than a regular full moon due to its proximity to Earth — will not be visible for nearly a year. (Image credit: Yasser Al-Zayyat)

Title: In northern Israel, migrant workers are farming while under fire from Hezbollah
Description: Foreign laborers, many from Thailand, are tending fields and livestock in an area Israel has declared off-limits to its own civilians amid ongoing military operations against Hezbollah. (Image credit: Amir Levy)

Title: The Onion wins auction for Alex Jones' media company
Description: The sale must be approved by a bankruptcy judge. Proceeds will go to paying down the $1.5 billion debt that Jones owes families of Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting victims who won two defamation suits against him. (Image credit: David J. Phillip)

Title: Australia will require social media platforms to act to prevent online harm to users
Description: Australia plans to require social media platforms to act to prevent online harms to users such as bullying, predatory behavior and algorithms pushing destructive content, the government said Thursday. (Image credit: Rick Rycroft)

Title: What a Trump presidency might mean for student loan forgiveness
Description: Several of President Biden's efforts at loan relief are in jeopardy, including a repayment plan with millions of borrowers waiting in limbo. (Image credit: Moor Studio)

Title: Why working-class voters have been shifting toward the Republican Party
Description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Penn State labor and employment relations professor Paul Clark about blue-collar voters and their decision to back President-elect Trump in this election.

Title: Morning news brief
Description: President-elect Trump plans to nominate Florida Rep. Matt Gaetz as attorney general, blue states to fight Trump administration policies, and police deploy in Paris ahead of France-Israel soccer match.

Title: Israel fails to meet U.S. demands on aid to Gaza. How are aid agencies coping?
Description: The U.S. says that Israel will not face consequences for failing to meet U.S. demands to provide more aid to avoid mass starvation in Gaza. What are aid organizations doing to cope?

Title: What it takes to run the Department of Defense
Description: Following the nomination of Fox News host Pete Hegseth as secretary of defense, we ask a retired Marine colonel and military expert Mark Cancian what it takes to run the DOD.

Title: California voters approve strengthening penalties for certain crimes
Description: California voters have overwhelmingly approved strengthening penalties for certain theft and drug crimes. They also ousted Los Angeles County's progressive district attorney.

Title: California voters approel strengthening penalties for certain crimes
Description: California voters have overwhelmingly approved strengthening penalties for certain theft and drug crimes. They also ousted Los Angeles County's progressive district attorney.

Title: Remembering Ted Olson, a titan of the law
Description: Ted Olson, the Bush-era solicitor general, has died at age 84. He was a towering figure in the legal profession who argued 65 cases at the Supreme Court as solicitor general and as a private lawyer. (Image credit: Alex Brandon)

Title: I was shocked': Lawmakers react to Gaetz pick to be Trump's attorney general
Description: Trump intends to nominate Rep. Matt Gaetz as attorney general and former Democratic Rep. Tulsi Gabbard as director of national intelligence, surprising many lawmakers who will have to confirm them. (Image credit: Allison Bailey)

Title: University of Rochester investigates 'Wanted' posters accusing staff of Gaza war crimes
Description: The posters, which appeared across campus, accuse university faculty of being complicit in war crimes against Palestinians in Gaza. The university president condemned the posters as antisemitic. (Image credit: Ted Shaffrey)

Title: Russia and North Korea Vow to Defend One Another
Description: North Korea and Russia each ratified a mutual defense treaty within days of each other. The pact means the countries will defend one another if attacked. And some say it may mean more involvement by North Korea in the war between Russia and Ukraine. We hear about the ramifications from our correspondent in Seoul.

Title: Florida power companies are trying to make the grid more resilient to hurricanes
Description: After back-to-back hurricanes triggered millions of power outages in Florida, power companies are trying to make the grid more resilient while also elastic enough to handle all the solar power flowing into the system.

Title: Trump names former Rep. Tulsi Gabbard for director of national intelligence
Description: The former Democratic congresswoman has shifted her political allegiance in recent years, going from a candidate for the Democratic presidential nomination in 2020 to a stalwart Trump supporter. (Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)

Title: Biden and Xi will meet on Saturday, the 3rd and likely final time during Biden's term
Description: This is likely to be their final meeting before President Biden leaves office. Biden sees it as a chance to reflect on the 'tough relationship' between the two countries, an official said. (Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)

Title: From high tariffs to isolation: What a 2nd Trump term might mean for foreign policy
Description: With wars raging around the world and high tariffs looming, Economist editor-in-chief Zanny Minton Beddoes says Trump's agenda may be chaotic — but she remains optimistic about possible good elements.

Title: Watch Live: Experts testify at UFO hearing in Congress
Description: A similar hearing last year brought extraordinary moments, including a retired intelligence officer alleging that the U.S. government has recovered nonhuman 'biologics' from crash sites. (Image credit: Alex Brandon)

Title: Trump would like to bring back mental institutions, but experts are skeptical
Description: Permanent tent cities are another idea Trump has for dealing with people who are unhoused. Sequestering people with mental illness or substance abuse in one place has been tried, an expert says, and 'it turns into hell on earth.' (Image credit: Qian Weizhon)

Title: The USS Edsall, sunk by Japanese forces in World War II, has been found
Description: The USS Edsall was overpowered by a Japanese fleet in the Indian Ocean but fought valiantly to the end, the U.S. Navy said. It was found in deep waters south of Australia's Christmas Island. (Image credit: U.S. Naval History and Heritage Command)

Title: In Lebanon, residents fear Hezbollah could be hiding among people displaced by war
Description: A neighborhood watch group in a Christian Beirut neighborhood is on the lookout for militant operatives, which could make the area a target for Israeli airstrikes. (Image credit: Ali Khara for NPR)

Title: Jump ball' for Alex Jones' media empire as it hits the auction block today
Description: Live bidding will be private, and the future owner of Jones' company will be public once court papers are filed. The proceeds will go to pay Sandy Hook families who won defamation cases against Jones. (Image credit: Jeff Kowalsky)

Title: Morning news brief
Description: Trump makes unconventional picks for top administration positions, a jury awards $42 million to three Iraqi men imprisoned in Abu Ghraib and world leaders are meeting to fight climate change at COP29.

Title: Utilities have shut off power to prevent wildfires. That can also cause problems
Description: Utility companies have been sued to bankruptcy over downed power lines that caused deadly wildfires in Hawaii and California. A Colorado utility's power shutoff to prevent fire also caused problems.

Title: U.S. jury awards $42 million to detainees mistreated while held in Abu Ghraib prison
Description: A U.S. jury awarded $42 million in damages to detainees mistreated while being held in Abu Ghraib prison in Iraq two decades ago.

Title: Violence by extremist Israeli settlers increases in the occupied West Bank
Description: Human rights groups say there have been at least 1,000 attacks by extremist Israeli settlers on Palestinians in the occupied West Bank in the past year. Hundreds have been driven from their homes.

Title: Israeli strikes kill dozens in the Gaza Strip and Lebanon, medics say
Description: Israeli airstrikes killed at least 46 people in the Gaza Strip in the past day, medics said. In Lebanon, warplanes struck Beirut's southern suburbs and killed 33 people in the country on Tuesday. (Image credit: Hassan Ammar)

Title: US prohibits airlines from flying to Haiti after planes were shot by gangs
Description: The shootings were part of a wave of violence that erupted as the country plagued by gang violence swore in its new prime minister after a politically tumultuous process. (Image credit: Odelyn Joseph)

Title: Trump will nominate South Dakota Gov. Kristi Noem for homeland security secretary
Description: The two-term governor of South Dakota has been a loyal Trump ally. In her new role, Noem would oversee immigration, an issue Trump campaigned heavily on. (Image credit: Jeff Dean)

Title: Former airman Jack Teixeira sentenced to 15 years for leaking classified documents
Description: The former Massachusetts Air National Guard member, Jack Teixeira, has been sentenced to 15 years in a federal prison for leaking classified documents about the war in Ukraine.

Title: New Zealand formally apologizes to victims of abuse in state care
Description: An inquiry found abuse, torture and neglect of some 200,000 people in state care over 70 years. People with disabilities or from Maori and Pacific Islander communities were especially vulnerable.

Title: Pentagon secrets leaker Jack Teixeira is sentenced to 15 years in prison
Description: A federal judge sentenced Jack Teixeira, a Massachusetts Air National Guard member, to prison after he pleaded guilty to leaking highly classified military documents about the war in Ukraine. (Image credit: Margaret Small)

Title: U.S. deadline for Israel has come as Palestinians in Gaza remain hungry
Description: U.S. gave Israel a month to increase aid into Gaza or face consequences under the law, but Palestinians still going hungry

Title: Supreme Court refuses legal lifesaver for former Trump chief of staff
Description: The Supreme Court dealt a major legal blow to former White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows on Tuesday, refusing to move the Georgia election interference charges against him to federal court. (Image credit: Saul Loeb)

Title: A Frank Assessment of Israel's Goals in Gaza From the Former Defense Minister
Description: Israel's Defense Minister was fired last week by Prime Minster Benjamin Netanyahu who said that trust had 'eroded' between them. The now former defense minister met with families of Israeli hostages held in Gaza and gave his thoughts on what Israel can still achieve in Gaza. We hear what was said.

Title: My Little Pony, Transformers, Phase 10 join the National Toy Hall of Fame
Description: The three 1980s staples are new National Toy Hall of Fame inductees. Hess Toy Trucks, the Pokémon Trading Card Game, the trampoline, and balloons were among the finalists.

Title: A U.S. jury awards former Iraqi detainees $42 million for Abu Ghraib prison abuse
Description: The jury also decided to hold a Virginia-based military contractor responsible for contributing to the torture and mistreatment of detainees at the notorious Iraqi prison two decades ago. (Image credit: Dana Verkouteren)

Title: Trump to name former Arkansas Gov. Mike Huckabee as ambassador to Israel
Description: In the midst of the Israel-Hamas war, President-elect Donald Trump announced he will nominate Huckabee, a loyalist and former Republican governor, to serve in the key post as ambassador to Israel. (Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)

Title: A man told 911 a bear chased him off a cliff. Weeks later, he was arrested for murder
Description: Authorities say Nicholas Hamlett killed a man in Tennessee in an attempt to steal his identity, and reported it to police as a bear attack. He was arrested in South Carolina after a weekslong manhunt.

Title: Federal judge blocks Louisiana law that requires classrooms to display Ten Commandments
Description: The new Louisiana requirement that the Ten Commandments be displayed in every public classroom by Jan. 1 was temporarily blocked Tuesday. The judge said the law is 'unconstitutional on its face.' (Image credit: John Bazemore)

Title: Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby resigns over sex abuse scandal
Description: Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby has resigned over accusations that he failed to report physical and sexual abuse to the police. (Image credit: Leon Neal)

Title: A man drove his car into a crowd in southern China, killing 35
Description: A man who authorities said was upset over his divorce settlement rammed his car into a crowd of people exercising at a sports complex in southern China, police said. (Image credit: Kyodo News)

Title: Dutch appeals court overturns landmark climate ruling against Shell
Description: The original 2021 ruling ordered Shell to cut its carbon emissions by 45% by 2030 compared to 2019 levels. The appeals court said there is 'insufficient consensus' on a specific reduction percentage. (Image credit: Frank Augstein)

Title: They're the most vulnerable of refugees. And they're remarkably resilient
Description: Sudan's civil war has displaced 10 million citizens. Here are profiles of two young people from the most vulnerable groups: an unaccompanied minor caring for twin brothers, a woman who was raped. (Image credit: Claire Harbage/NPR)

Title: Top contenders to lead the Senate. And, Trump's DOJ priorities
Description: Congress reconvenes this week with a top priority: electing the leaders of each chamber. Here's a look at the contenders. And, top priorities for Trump's Justice Department.

Title: Gangs in Haiti shot at a Spirit Airlines plane as it was trying to land in Port-Au-Prince
Description: Violence continues in Haiti, despite the appointment of a new prime minister. The international airport was shut down after shots were fired at a landing commercial flight.

Title: Dozens of Israelis taken captive by Hamas more than a year ago are still being held
Description: How do family members keep hope alive of one day reuniting with their loved ones? NPR's Michel Martin talks Yarden Gonen, whose sister Romi was taken hostage during the Oct. 7 Hamas attack on Israel.

Title: Morning news brief
Description: President-elect Trump is likely to influence who's chosen as Senate and House leaders. Trump must decide who will lead the Justice Department. President Biden travels to Peru and Brazil this week.

Title: Dry weather in New York and New Jersey leads to a rash of dangerous wildfires
Description: Wildfires have been raging in New York and New Jersey. People in some areas have been asked to prepare for possible evacuations.

Title: Embroiderers gather for peace -- each stitch represents a person killed in Gaza
Description: People come together every Tuesday on the University of Michigan campus to work on a tapestry based on traditional Palestinian embroidery. Each stitch represents a death in Gaza.

Title: Small Ohio River town embraces butterflies to symbolize change, recovery
Description: People in New Richmond designed a butterfly garden as a symbol of recovery for a former flood land, and for people who have struggled with addiction

Title: Harriet Tubman posthumously named a general in Veterans Day ceremony
Description: Revered abolitionist Harriet Tubman, who was the first woman to oversee an American military action during a time of war, was posthumously awarded the rank of general on Monday. (Image credit: Julio Cortez)

Title: New Zealand's leader apologizes to survivors of abuse in state and church care
Description: An estimated 200,000 people, many of them Indigenous Māori, suffered abuse in New Zealand's foster and faith-based care over a period of seven decades (Image credit: Robert Kitchin)

Title: Indiana man is found guilty of murder in the 2017 killings of 2 teenage girls
Description: A former drugstore worker in the small Indiana community of Delphi was found guilty of murder on Monday in the killings of two teenage girls who vanished during an afternoon hike. (Image credit: Darron Cummings)

Title: Israel's EL Al Airlines Turns Profits by Continuing to Fly
Description: Israel's airlines are generating a windfall as international carriers cancel or limit flights due to security concerns. Flying in or out of Israel has become a logistical challenge since the war in Gaza erupted. (Image credit: GIL COHEN-MAGEN)

Title: Michigan's apple season has been booming. Growers are trying to slow it down
Description: In the big apple-growing state of Michigan, the harvest is expected to be huge for the third year in a row. But bigger isn't always better, and growers are working on ways to slow down the harvest.

Title: Uncertainty remains after Haiti's transitional government ousted its prime minister
Description: Haiti's transitional government has ousted their prime minister, but that transitional leader says the move is unconstitutional and he is not going anywhere.

Title: This coffee shop brings veterans together and holds years of military artifacts
Description: A coffee shop in a small town in North Carolina has become a place for veterans to get together while also serving as a museum of sorts, as it holds photos and medals from the past 100 years.

Title: Haiti swears in a new leader as gangs shoot at a flight landing in the main airport
Description: Haiti's international airport shut down temporarily after gangs opened fire at a Spirit Airlines flight landing in Port-Au-Prince. The latest violence came as a new prime minister was sworn in. (Image credit: Odelyn Joseph)

Title: 25 of 43 monkeys have been recovered after escaping a lab in South Carolina last week
Description: A research facility in Yemassee, S.C., has recovered 25 of the 43 monkeys that escaped from the laboratory last week after a caretaker accidentally left the door to their enclosure unsecured. (Image credit: John Raoux)

Title: Stephen Miller is heading back to the White House as Trump's deputy chief of staff
Description: One of the architects of Trump's family separation policy during his first time in office, Miller will return to the White House in a key role. (Image credit: Michael Ciaglo)

Title: A 'Wicked' mistake: Mattel apologizes for printing a porn site on its doll packaging
Description: Mattel is pulling its Wicked dolls from some store shelves because of a misprint directing shoppers to a pornographic site. Meanwhile, resellers are listing the products on eBay for up to $500. (Image credit: Jordan Strauss)

Title: Taurid meteor shower to light up the night sky. Here's how you can see it
Description: The North and South Taurids occur every year in September, October, and November. They may have originated from a comet that broke up about 10,000 years ago. (Image credit: AP)

Title: Trump plans to revoke many Biden policies. Where does that leave marijuana?
Description: The president-elect recently affirmed that he supports legalizing marijuana for recreational use. His stance means cannabis could be a rare issue on which Trump carries a Biden policy forward. (Image credit: Mario Tama)

Title: A Marine Corps veteran expresses concerns for the military in a 2nd Trump presidency
Description: Essayist Phil Klay says Trump tried to use the military to push his partisan agenda before, and may further erode norms around the military as he looks for those willing to 'go with his whims.'

Title: It was 'great relief' for Haruki Murakami to finish his latest novel
Description: In the first interview about his new book The City and its Uncertain Walls, the celebrated author also talks with NPR about his age and finding beauty in isolation. (Image credit: Alvaro Barrientos)

Title: What to know about Tom Homan, the former ICE head returning as Trump's 'border czar'
Description: Homan was the acting director of Immigration and Customs Enforcement from January 2017 to June 2018, where he was a key architect of the Trump administration's controversial family separation policy. (Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)

Title: Trump's reelection casts a shadow over the start of global climate negotiations
Description: Trump's return to the White House raises questions about whether the country will continue working on global climate initiatives. (Image credit: Sergei Grits)

Title: Wisconsin high court to hear arguments on whether an 1849 abortion ban remains valid
Description: The Wisconsin Supreme Court will hear oral arguments Monday on whether a law that legislators adopted more than a decade before the Civil War bans abortion and can still be enforced. (Image credit: Harm Venhuizen)

Title: Climb aboard the SS United States before it takes its final voyage
Description: The SS United States, a record-breaking American ocean liner from the 1950s, will take its final voyage from Philadelphia to the Gulf of Mexico this week.

Title: Israel's fired defense minister slams Netanyahu on his last day
Description: Israel's ousted defense minister says the military achieved all of its Gaza objectives, and the prime minister held up a cease-fire deal that would have ended the war and freed remaining hostages.

Title: When her key broke in the ignition, a car thief saved the day
Description: After her car key broke, Betsy Cornwell was stranded and all alone. Then the unlikeliest of heroes came to her aid. (Image credit: Betsy Cornwell)

Title: It's Veterans Day. The VA says it can't help thousands of vets it left stranded
Description: An NPR investigation finds thousands of veterans were pushed into high-cost mortgages by a program that was meant to help them. A rescue plan being rolled out by the Department of Veterans Affairs is excluding many vets who need help. (Image credit: Michael Noble Jr.)

Title: Wounded WWII veteran in Scranton, Pa., leads orchestra at age 99
Description: Gene Passarella went to war as a teenager, but his Army career ended with an injury that eventually earned him a Purple Heart. He's better known in his hometown of Scranton for his music.

Title: Morning news brief
Description: Republicans won the White House and Senate and maybe the House. Does Donald Trump’s win threaten the future of Obamacare? Israel’s ousted defense minister says there’s nothing more to achieve in Gaza.

Title: A human bird flu case is thought to be found in Canada for the first time
Description: A person has tested positive in British Columbia, Canadian health officials said, though the results must be sent to another lab for confirmation. (Image credit: Cynthia Goldsmith, Jackie Katz)

Title: Haiti replaces its prime minister, marking more turmoil in transition process
Description: It marks even more turmoil in an already rocky democratic transition process for Haiti, which hasn't held democratic elections in years in a large part due to the soaring levels of gang violence. (Image credit: Brian Inganga)

Title: How the Gulf is reacting to Trump's election
Sacked Israeli defense minister speaks to hostage families
Description: A hostage relative tells NPR that now-former Israeli defense minister Yoav Gallant said a deal could have been reached already

Title: Trump's second term could force NATO into a reckoning with its relationship with the US
Description: NPR’s Ayesha Rascoe asks Heather Conley of the German Marshall Fund of the United States what Donald Trump's second term could mean for NATO and the war in Ukraine.

Title: Israel's ousted defense minister says the military has done all it can in Gaza
Description: On his last day in office, Israel's ousted defense minister offered a revealing glimpse into the war in Gaza — and the decision-maker he holds responsible for holding up a cease-fire deal. (Image credit: Gil Cohen-Magen/AP)

Title: How one Ukrainian chef is fighting for culinary independence
Description: In a cookbook forged during the war with Russia, a Ukrainian celebrity chef uses cuisine to 'continue the story of Ukraine.' (Image credit: Oksana Parafeniuk for NPR)

Title: Qatar suspends mediation efforts between Israel and Hamas
Description: The Arab Gulf nation, a U.S. ally that has been a haven for Hamas leaders for nearly two decades, also said it will no longer host the Palestinian militant group’s political office, an official said. (Image credit: Eyad Baba)

Title: Officials say Qatar has decided to suspend its mediation efforts on Gaza
Description: Qatar has decided to suspend its key mediation efforts between Hamas and Israel, officials said Saturday. The announcement comes after growing frustration with the lack of progress on a deal. (Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)

Title: El Al is the airline that just keeps flying for those going in or out of Israel
Description: Anyone who has tried to visit Israel since the Gaza war began will know how the logistical challenges of flying in or out of the country. This has been a windfall for Israel’s airlines.

Title: Israeli soccer fans were attacked in Amsterdam
Description: Soccer fans from Israel were attacked in Amsterdam in what the Dutch prime minister called 'antisemitic attacks on Israeli citizens.' (Image credit: InterVision)

Title: Israel's Netanyahu sacks defense minister
Description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu fired his defense minister on U.S. election day, sparking protests in Israel.

Title: Netanyahu could take steps to end wars after Trump's win, Middle East officials say
Description: Officials throughout the Middle East welcomed Donald Trump’s victory — amid anticipation and anxiety across the region over how he could change the course of the wars raging from Gaza to Lebanon and beyond. (Image credit: Saul Loeb)
